The representative of the group, named Edwige Sènan, is the one who has her hand raised in the photo. Edwige Sènan is 29 years old and lives in Bénin. Edwige Sènan did not go to school. Edwige Sènan is married to a certain Roger. The couple has two children, both in school and under their care. Edwige Sènan lives together with her children and her husband and takes care of the diverse household responsibilities together with her husband. 

In order to meet her needs and those of her children, Edwige Sènan has been managing a business selling fabric and haberdashery items in a town of Bénin for 18 years. Edwige Sènan gets her supplies in a market of Bénin. In seeking to satisfy her clientèle and to grow her turnover and her income, Edwige Sènan is requesting a third loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the Nonvigbe A group. The first two loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabric and haberdashery items.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 53 years old, married, and has five children.  He lives in the Philippines. With his wife's assistance, Noel has a food shop or carenderia (mini-restaurant) that sells items like afritada (chicken stew made with vegetables and tomatoes) and caldereta, which he has been doing for 20 years.. He also raises and sells pigs.  

Noel is requesting a loan for 11,000 PHP, which he will use to buy raw ingredients for making food.  He has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Noel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Une Femme De Plus Group

texts.fr: UNE FEMME DE PLUS est un groupe composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Monique (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 47 ans. Monique est mariée à un certain Marc. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Monique vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la maison. Monique a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Monique mène comme activité la vente de paniers et de nattes de façon ambulante depuis une dizaine d'année au Benin. Monique s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Monique sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe UNE FEMME DE PLUS un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les  crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
UNE FEMME DE PLUS is a group consisting of five people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group by the name of Monique (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 47 years old. Monique is married to a certain Marc. The couple has five children, all in school and under their care. Monique lives together with her children and her husband and takes care of the household responsibilities together with her husband. Monique stopped school at the secondary level. 

To take care of her different responsibilities, Monique has been managing a business selling baskets and mats as a travelling saleswoman in Bénin for about 10 years. Monique gets her supplies in a market of Bénin. With the goal of better meeting the demands of her increasing clientèle and to make more profit, Monique is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the UNE FEMME DE PLUS group. The previously received loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy baskets and mats.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel tiene  2 pequeños junto a su esposa, la misma que se dedica a la venta de sándwich y hamburguesas en la puerta de su casa todas las noches. Actualmente esta pequeña familia vive en la ciudad de Ica, Perú, lugar que se caracteriza por el incremento de tiendas comerciales y el desarrollo económico que se refleja en sus pobladores.

Miguel se dedica a elaborar puertas y ventanas de madera, productos que son demandados en promedio 3 veces al día, para esto Miguel se dedica a laborar un promedio de 9 horas, tiempo en el que atiende a sus clientes y elabora los productos solicitados. Fue gracias a su padre que aprendió sobre este negocio, por lo que él está muy agradecido por el empeño que le puso por enseñarle.

Miguel es muy conocido por su trabajo ya que sus clientes siempre están satisfechos con los resultados. Con ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, él podrá realizarle el mantenimiento pertinente  a sus máquinas, a su vez podrá comprar un cepillo eléctrico.  Esto le permitirá tener un instrumento adicional para labrar la madera, ofrecerá un nuevo servicio y así su negocio podrá crecer, lo que le permitirá tener una sucursal en el distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú.
texts.en:
Miguel and his wife have two young children.  Every night his wife sells sandwiches and hamburgers at the door to his house.  This small family currently lives in the city of Ica, Perú.  This place is known for its growth of commercial stores and the economic development that is reflected in its inhabitants.

Miguel makes wooden doors and windows.  These products are ordered on the average of three times a week.  Therefore, Miguel works an average of nine hours a day.  He waits on his customers, and he makes the requested products.  It was thanks to his father that he learned about the business.  He is very grateful for the effort his father put into teaching him.

Miguel is well-known for his work because his customers are always satisfied with the results.

With help from the Kiva lenders he will be able to perform maintenance on his machines and buy an electric planer.  This will allow him to have an additional tool to use when working with wood.  He will offer a new service, and this way his business will be able to grow.  This will allow him to have a branch in the Parcona district, Ica, Perú.

loans.use: to have maintenance performed on his machines and to buy an electric planer.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda con su anterior credikiva aprovechó el segundo semestre del 2010, época en la cual lo que mas se vende ropa y eso fue justamente lo que hizo, por eso sus ventas se incrementaron significativamente. Como con este negocio de ropa ganó clientela, ahora va a invertir nuevamente en telas para hacer ropa en mayor cantidad, con lo cual ganará descuentos y tendrá satisfechos a sus clientes,  que desde ya se están preparando para vestir elegantes durante la celebración del día de la secretaria y de otro dia mas importante para las familias colombianas: "el día de las madres." Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: "Muchos agradecimientos a Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y sigan apoyando mi negocio. "
texts.en: Yolanda used her previous Kiva loan to take advantage of the second half of 2010, when most clothing sales take place.  Her sales increased significantly.  Since she gained some customers with for this clothing business, she will once again invest in fabrics to make clothing in large quantity.  This will allow her to gain some discounts and also satisfy her customers, who are preparing to dress up in celebration of secretary’s day, and also another important day for Columbian families, Mother’s Day.  Her message to Kiva lenders is, “I’m very grateful to Kiva and Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for continuing to support my business.”

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario is 51 years old and lives in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 3 children. Rosario works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. She is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Rosario hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells food such as yams, cassava and plantains, which she has done for 2 years now. She is married and has 5 dependents. Her husband works with the railways company. Mary uses her income to assist the husband to feed and clothe their children. Mary will use her loan to purchase yams, cassava and plantains to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase yams, cassava and plantains to sell

loans.name: Annette

texts.en: Annette is 28 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. Annette has a general store business and earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing the additional groceries and consumable goods for her business. Annette became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Annette hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Jhanese

texts.en: A single mother of one child, Jhanese is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines where she has had a  pigpen that sells grown pigs for the past two years. Jhanese has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 and is now requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to  buy animal feed for the pigs. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en: Mbeyu is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to start another business of charcoal selling. With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She dreams of expanding to  wholesale in the future. Thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving her an opportunity to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
This is Liezel, 40, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Prudencio, a transport operator, and they have one child. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, Liezel is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Liezel operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Liezel is requesting a Php 22,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Liezel hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Gladys Sandra

texts.es:
Gladys es una mujer de 38 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de ropa como recorredora en la ciudad de Ica. Ella culminó el colegio por completo, estaba deseosa por estudiar secretariado cuando lamentablemente sus padres no tenían los ingresos necesarios para solventar sus gastos de educación superior.

Actualmente ella labora un promedio de 5 horas diarias, caminando y recorriendo las zonas aledañas en donde vive. Ella vende ropa tanto para adultos como para niños, es este el motivo por el que la cantidad de sus clientes se ha ido incrementando en el transcurso de estos meses.

Gladys está muy deseosa de poder comprar nueva ropa, para que de esta manera sus clientes tengan más opciones y se sientan satisfechos por las compras que realizan. Ella sabe que esto permitirá que sus ingresos se incrementen y así logrará tener la tienda que tanto desea en un lugar cercano de la ciudad, a su vez realizará su gran sueño tener una Boutique en su casa.
texts.en:
Gladys, age 38, sells clothes as a street vendor in the city of Ica.  She completed her education, and she wanted to study to become an administrative assistant.  Unfortunately, her parents did not have the income that was needed to cover her higher educational expenses.

She currently works an average of five hours a day walking and traveling to the areas neighboring where she lives.  She sells clothes as much for adults as for children.  That is the reason that she has gotten more customers in the past few months.

Gladys really wants to be able to buy new clothes.  This way her customers will have more choices, and they will feel satisfied with the purchases they make.  She knows that this will allow her income to increase.  Then she will manage to have the store she wishes for so much in a place near the city.  At the same time she will fulfill her big dream of having a boutique in her house.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip, a 44-year-old married father of four children ranging in age from 6 to 22 years, describes himself as an honest man. For the past six years he has operated a retail shop selling home products, and employs two staff members. Philip's business is located in a competitive urban area, and his primary customers are local residents. His biggest business challenge is insufficient funds to improve the retail shop.

Philip will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy more home products, and his business goal is to expand his shop within five years. He hopes that he will be able to build a house for his family and improve their living standards in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of home products.

loans.name: Eli

texts.es: Eli, tiene la edad 47de  años, está casado y vive con sus tres hijos y la esposa. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de dos novillos  para el engorde. El cuenta con varios novillos a su poder y lo que pretende es fortalecer el negocio. El quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de sus padres y crecer con le proyecto de cría de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Eli is 47 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children.  He wants to use the money from this loan to buy two steers to fatten up.  He has several steers and he wants to strengthen his business.  He wants to have his animals at the ideal weight for later resale in the local market and more distant places.  He wants to generate the greatest amount of income for his well-being and that of his parents and also grow his pig business.  This will be his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has not had any previous bank loans, but FUDECOSUR has granted him a loan with ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy steers.

loans.name: Nuris

texts.es: Nuris de 62 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 30 y 35 años. Ella tiene un negocio donde comercializa productos energéticos dirigidos especialmente a personas que practican una actividad física, como ejercicios y aeróbicos. Su actividad la inició cuando su hijo emprendió un gimnasio y sus clientes cuando finalizaban sus actividades, requerían hidratarse para reponer la pérdida de líquido su cuerpo.  Con este negocio Nuris se vinculó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, desde hace 4 años, desde los cuales ha recibido 6 financiamientos, con los que ha logrado comprar en mayor volumen sus productos y con el resultado de su venta programa los pagos y se siente muy tranquila de poder hacerlo fácilmente. Su meta futura es apoyar la ampliación del Gimnasio de su hijo, adecuando otra sala donde incluiría a su vez nuevos productos. Su mayor desafío son las bajas temporadas en las cuales no hay muchos clientes como ella lo espera, pero en su experiencia conoce cuales son estas épocas y puede controlar sus inversiones. En la actualidad está aplicando a su séptimo credikiva, con el cual comprará productos energéticos y continuará aumentand su capital de trabajo por eso su credikiva es un éxito para  su nueva  inversión.
texts.en: Nuris is 62 years old, lives south of the city, and has 2 children ages 30 and 35. She has a business where she sells energy products specially aimed towards people that do a physical activity like exercises or aerobics. Her business began when her son started a gym and his customers, when finished working out, would need to hydrate themselves in order to replenish the loss of liquid in their body. With this business Nuris joined the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation 4 years ago. Since then she has received 6 loans, with which she has been able to purchase her products in larger volumes  and with the results of her sales she feels calm about being able to make the payments easily. Her future goal is to support the growth of her son's gym, adapting another room where she would include her products. Her greatest challenge are the low seasons in which there aren't as many customers as she hopes, but in her experience she knows when these periods are and can control her investments. Currently she is applying for her 7th kiva credit with which she will buy energy products and will continue increasing her work capital so that her kiva credit is a success for her new investment.

loans.use: to buy energy products.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
La Sra. Ramona tiene 48 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos todos menores de edad, que se encuentran en la escuela. Vive en su modesta casa en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
La Sra. Ramona se dedica a la venta de chipa (alimento típico paraguayo). Ella tiene su chipería propia, hace aproximadamente 10 años, en la cual elabora las chipas que vende. Ella se ha hecho de muy buena fama debido a la buena calidad de los productos que vende. Ella realiza sus ventas en la zona de Mariano Roque Alonso. ya posee una buena clientela formada.
Solicita el crédito para la compras de materias prima que utiliza para la elaboración de las chipas que vende, como ser Harina, queso, huevos, manteca y otros. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de Kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Ramona, age 48, is married and has two minor children who go to school.  She lives in her modest house in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.

Ramona sells cheese buns.  She has had her own cheese bun bakery for approximately ten years.  That is where she makes the cheese buns that she sells.  She has an excellent reputation because of the quality of the products that she sells.  She makes her sales in the Mariano Roque Alonso zone.  She now has a well-established customer base.

She is requesting the loan to purchase the ingredients she needs to make the cheese buns that she sells.  She will buy things like flour, cheese, eggs,  lard, and others.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting from Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy flour, cheese, eggs, lard, and others.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Gina has a food shop in the school canteen where she sells snacks like cookies, candies & rice cakes . She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks .
Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 .  In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is married with 1 child. Zosima is 60 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.
Zosima sells vegetables to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years.  She has requested a loan of PHP 14900 to  purchase fertilizers for her vegetable garden.
Zosima has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Zosima hopes to have additional areas for vegetable culture and production.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Deysi Giuliana

texts.es:
Deysi es una mujer que tiene un pequeño de 8 años por el cual se desvive día a día y está dispuesta a afrontar distintas cosas por el mejor desarrollo de su pequeño. Actualmente ella se dedica a dos negocios, tiene una pequeña botica y un centro funerario, donde atiende un promedio de 6 horas diarias.

Ella nos comenta que es muy triste ver como las familias realizan la compra de ataúdes y sabe que esta necesidad existe de por sí. Deysi nos comenta que siempre los ofrece a precios cómodos y que aprendió de este negocio debido a que trabaja en un centro funerario hacia algún tiempo. 

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, ella podrá realizar la compra de ataúdes de menor tamaño y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Así podrá tener mayor variedad y juntar el dinero necesario para poner su botica en otro lugar, lo que le permitirá comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
Deysi is a woman who has a small son who is 8 years old for whom she cannot do enough and is prepared to face different things for his better development. Currently, she is dedicated to two businesses. She has a small boutique and a funeral center, where she serves six hours a day on average.

She tells us that she is very sad to see families buy coffins and knows that this need exists, per se. Deysi tells us that she always offers affordable prices and that she learned this business when she worked in a funeral center some time ago.

With the help of the Kiva lenders, she will be able to buy coffins of a smaller size and satisfy the needs of her customers. This way she will be able to have greater variety and gather the money necessary to start a boutique in another place, which will allow her to buy her own house.

loans.use: to purchase coffins.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Lucila has a poultry farm that sells grown chickens & ducks per kilogram. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy animal feeds for the chickens & ducks.
Lucila has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Lucila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for her chickens & ducks

loans.name: Wilver

texts.es: Wilver, tiene la edad 30 de  años, está casado y vive con la esposa. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de pollos de engorde y comprar el concentrado para su mantención. El cuenta con las instalaciones  para desarrollar el proyecto de pollos de engorde. El quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y el de su familia y crecer con le proyecto de cría de pollos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Wilver is 30 years old. He is married and lives with his wife. With the loan he intends to buy chickens to fatten and to buy the concentrate for their maintenance. He has the facility to develop the chicken project. He wants to have his animals with the ideal weight for their sale later in the market in town or in nearby areas. He wishes to generate a greater quantity of earnings for his wellbeing and that of his family and to grow with the chicken raising project. This is the first loan received from Fudecosur. He has not had other loans before in state banks but Fudecosur has provided the loan to him with greater facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy chicken to fatten.

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception is 57 years old and lives in Caloocan City, the Philippines. She is married to a welder and the mother of two children. She earns a living by selling dried fish which her husband processes and lets dry until it is ready to be sold in the market. Her store is located in a temporary fish market, and her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

She is requesting a loan for PHP 16,000 to buy more fish to sell. She expects a boost in her business from this expansion. Her goal is to continue growing her business and give her family a good future through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week and draw strength and inspiration from religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 69 and a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is a widow and the mother to two children. She earns a living by operating an aluminum and glass shop. She handles finances, accounts, inventories and promotion. Her company makes aluminum doors and window glass to order, and also repairs any type of aluminum doors or windows brought to them. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community. She earns a minimum of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week. 

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will use this loan to buy supplies like glass, aluminum, silicon and other materials. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Lucita dreams of opening new branches and hopes to get to more customers in the market. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Norayma

texts.es: Norayma  de 43 años de edad tiene un negocio de miscelánea en el centro de la ciudad, donde vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijas en las edades de 12 a 17 años. Cuando inició su actividad comercial, lo hizo con flores artificiales, que le daban sus proveedores a consignación, es decir ella devolvía las flores  que no vendía. Así hizo su primera clientela y gradualmente fue conociendo mas personas que la recomendaban y hacían pedidos como prendas de plata y artículos para el hogar entre otros. Su negocio fue inspirado en la necesidad de generar ingresos,  que pidiera unir a los producidos por su esposo,  también un gran trabajador  que ejerce como técnico  de refrigeración. Con ello  aumentó  las posibilidades de generar bienestar en su hogar y una  vez afianzada su clientela, compró poco a poco, vitrinas y enseres y fue agregando cada vez más mercancías,  con las que ha logrado fortalecer su miscelánea, la cual está ubicada en un punto estratégico. Lograr sus metas de trabajo para Norayma es muy importante, porque sueña con apoyar a sus hijas en que logren sus propósitos de ser profesionales exitosas. En la actualidad está planeando acceder a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará ropa para damas, calzado y bolsos, pues se prepara para el día de las madres, y es justamente en el mes de Mayo donde sus ventas se incrementan, porque todos los clientes en familia, quieren vestir elegantes y hacer los mejores regalos a la mujer que significa el ser mas tierno e incondicional de la vida: “ la madre.”
texts.en: Norayma, 43 years old, has a business selling miscellaneous items in the center of the city where she lives with her husband and their three daughters who are ages 12 to 17 years old. When she started this commercial activity, she did it selling artificial flowers which were given to her by suppliers on consignment, i.e. she returned the flowers that did not sell. In this way she made her first customers and gradually she got to know more people who recommended her and she took orders like silver garments and articles for the home, among others. Her business was inspired by the need to generate income and bring together those produced by her husband, also a hard worker who works as a refrigerator technician. With that, the possibilities to generate wellbeing in her home increased and once she had the trust of her customers, she gradually bought window cases and equipment and increased her merchandise with which she has managed to establish her miscellaneous shop which is located in a strategic place. To achieve her career goals is very important to Norayma because she dreams of supporting her daughters in their goal of becoming successful professionals. Currently, she is planning to access CrediKiva, the first loan from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy women's clothing, shoes and bags as she is preparing for mother's day and it is in the month of May when her sales increase because all of her customers with family want to dress elegantly and give the best gifts to the woman who means to be the most tender and unconditional of life: mother.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for women, shoes and bags.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married and has three children who range in age from 15 to 21 years old. She describes herself as honest, and earns a living by operating a stall where she sells food. She has been involved in this business for four years. She works in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high price of food. She will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy more food to sell to her customers. Her business goal is to open a retail shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Felipe Rafael

texts.es:
Felipe es un joven de 25 años, que se dedica a la elaboración de prótesis dentales, carrea que ha estudiado en los últimos años, esta iniciativa y esfuerzo académico le ha permitido crear su pequeña microempresa, por lo que está muy contento de la labora que viene realizar con sus pacientes.

Felipe le dedica a su negocio un promedio de 8 horas diarias y es en este tiempo en donde atiende solicitudes y a su vez realiza 1 prótesis dental según las especificaciones que sus clientes le indiquen. Fue gracias a una amiga a que él se inicio en su negocio y está muy contento por haber recibido bien su sugerencia.

Actualmente Felipe tiene que alquilar un horno frecuentemente y esto le obliga a realizar siempre un gasto extra y a su vez disminuye su tiempo de estancia en su propio negocio, es por este motivo que él desea realizar la compra de un horno especial para prótesis dental, de esta manera sus ingresos puedan incrementarse. El considera que este ahorro le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y así poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación podrá construir su tienda de prótesis, lo que lo llevará a su gran sueño, comprarse un carro propio.
texts.en:
Felipe is 25 years old and makes dentures for a living, a career he has studied in recent years. This initiative and academic strength has allowed him to grow his small business, which is why he is very happy from the work that he does with his patients.

Felipe dedicates himself to his business an average of 8 hours daily, and it is this time where he addresses requests and to make 1 set of dentures according to the specification that his clients indicate. It was thanks to a friend that he started this business and is very happy for having received her good suggestion.

Today Felipe has to rent a furnace frequently and this obligates him to always have an extra expense and diminishes his time being at his own business. It is for this reason that he wants to purchase a special furnace for dental prosthesis, and in this way he can increase his income. He believes that this savings will allow him to improve his income and little by little with the strength and dedication he will be able to construct a store of dentures, which will bring him to his great dream, to purchase himself a car of his own.

loans.use: to purchase a furnace to create dentures.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice seed and chemical fertilizer, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 55 and a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. Her husband is an overseas contract worker. She manages their household while also running a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products from popular brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange and others. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Her prices are lower than those in the catalog, and this is how she earns a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy merchandise and place orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business, and hopes to continue growing her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from her religion. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who meet weekly to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo Group

texts.es: La Sra. Elvia torres 58  años de edad,  es viuda  y tiene 1 hijo, Elvia  actualmente es socia en la alcancía comunal “Jesucristo es mi modelo” grupo  conformado por 9  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.  Elvia  se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza  a domicilio y a su vez vende comida los fines de semana. Elvia  inicia este negocio a raiz del fallecimiento de su esposo, a su vez queria obtener una mejor calidad de vida es asi que trabajo muy duro,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación   a obtenido mejores ingresos economicos y muebles para su casa. Elvia  ha solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercaderia ya que va a empezar a vender gaseosas.  Elvia  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Elvia Torres is 58 years old, widowed and has one child. Elvia is currently a member of the communal bank "Jesucristo es mi modelo" or "Jesus Christ is my role model," a group made up of 9 members that engage in various business activities for a living. Elvia sells beauty products at home for a living and at the same time sells food on the weekends. Elvia began this business in the wake of the death of her huband. At this time she wanted to obtain a better quality of life and it is for this that she worked very hard. Thanks to her strength and dedication she obtained better economic income and furniture for her house. Elvia has requested a new loan in order to buy merchandise as she is going to begin selling soda. Elvia will achieve her goals with much work and strength and the loans from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: to purchase soda.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 27-year-old married woman. She has two children who are 6 and 7 years old, and both are enrolled in school. Her husband is a truck driver, and she operates a business selling second-hand clothes at a local market. She's worked in this business for three years, and her customers are mostly neighbors and passersby. Sarah's other source of income comes from a fruit and juice-selling business. She says her greatest business challenge is the high cost of transportation and her highest monthly expense is rent. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped-in water. Sarah will use this Kes 40,000 loan to purchase bales of clothes to resell. Her goal is to open a boutique to earn more profits in the future. She joined Yehu because of our low interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Norelvis Alejandra

texts.es: Norelvis está extendiendo su inversión hacia una actividad comercial, con los mismos clientes de su otro negocio de producción de articulos en cuero y sus derivados; por eso con su anterior credikiva compró mercancía variada como celulares, suéteres, que vendió y con los que respondió a su clientela. Ella está ahora aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará celulares, sueteres y ropa en general,  para cumplir compromisos adquiridos con sus fieles compradores, especialmente en la época estudiantil, por eso será exitosa su inversión, porque ajusta sus compras a los requerimientos de lo que cada temporada marca como de punta en sus ventas.  Ella agradece y pide a los financiadores de Kiva; “Que sigan con esa iniciativa de ayudar a la gente con grandes sueños. “
texts.en: Norelvis is extending her investment doing a commercial activity with the same customers from her other business of production of articles in leather and their derivatives. With her previous Kiva credit she purchased various merchandise like cell phones and sweaters that she sold and with which she responded to her customers. She is now applying for a new loan with which she will buy cell phones, sweaters, and clothes in general in order to fulfill commitments acquired with her loyal shoppers, especially in the student age. This will be a successful investment because she adjusts her purchases to the requirements of each season marks as peak in sales. She is grateful to the Kiva financiers and asks "that they continue with this initiative of helping people with great dreams."

loans.use: to purchase cell phones, sweaters, and clothes in general.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
This is Angelina, 55, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is a widow and mother to her three children. She, together with her children, manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Angelina operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus there is a need for them, especially for students who need to do their research and papers. She rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy new computer units, spare parts, and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Angelina hopes to give her children a good future and a high quality education through all her hard work on her business. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy computer parts and supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en: Rochelle is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. Rochelle provides transportation services using a motorcycle with a sidecar. Her husband is the driver. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for her motorcycle. Rochelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rochelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline

loans.name: Aliboi

texts.ru: Алибой энергичный молодой человек. У него 3 маленьких детей, которых он очень любит. Алибой занимается откормом скота, сейчас его скот находиться на пастбище в горах. Также у него есть небольшой ларек с продуктами питания, так как животноводство имеет не постоянный доход, для этого он и имеет дополнительный доход от продажи продуктов питания. Он получает у нас второй кредит и с каждым разом старается увеличивать поголовье скота.
texts.en: Aliboi is an energetic young man.  He has three small children, whom he loves very much.  Aliboi is involved in fattening up livestock, which is currently at a pasture in the mountains.  He also has a small kiosk, where he sells food products.  Because animal husbandry does not have a consistent income, he earns an additional income from sales of food products.  This is his second loan, and he tries to increase his livestock headcount each time.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Christ Est Vivant Group

texts.fr: Le groupe CHRIST EST VIVANT est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Diane est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Diane est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un tourneur du nom de Gildas. Diane n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Diane vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Diane vend depuis dix ans des mèches, des produits cosmétiques et des tissus de façon secondaire dans son quartier. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Diane s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Diane sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe CHRIST EST VIVANT, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The CHRIST EST VIVANT group is made up of four people who live in the same neighborhood. The is the third time that this group has asked ALIDé for financial help, in order to increase their level of activity. The group's representative, Diane, has her hand raised in the photo. Diane is 30 years old and married to a turner named Gildas. Diane did not go to school. The couple has three children, all of whom go to school and are in their care. Diane lives with her husband and children. The couple share the household's various expenses. 

To help meet the family's needs, for the last ten years Diane has sold hair extensions and cosmetic products, along with fabric as a secondary business, in her neighborhood. This activity allows her to meet her needs without too much difficulty. Diane obtains her supplies in a market in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and increase turnover and revenue, Diane and the other CHRIST EST VIVANT members are asking ALIDé for a third loan. The two previous loans were fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, cosmetic products, and fabric.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура- женщина 44 лет, замужем, имеет двоих детей.Её муж нигде не работает,занимается птицеводством и откормом баранов.Она сама работает гладильщицей в швейной фабрике.С наступлением весны Манзура стала чувствовать себя не важно поэтому хочет провезти стационарное лечение, поэтому решила получить кредит. Её сын хочет сам погашать кредит матери, он работает мастером по евро ремонту квартир, и его доход вполне хватает на погашение требуемого кредита. Манзура благодарна инвесторам  KIVA, за поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Manzura is a 44 year-old woman, who has two children.  Her husband is not employed anywhere and is involved in poultry farming and fattening up sheep.  Manzura works as an ironing lady at a sewing factory.  With onset of spring, Manzura started to feel unwell, and this is why she wants to obtain this loan in order to get a hospital treatment.  Her son wants to repay his mother's loan by himself.  He works as a contractor, specializing in euro-repairs of apartments, and his income is quite sufficient to repay the requested loan.  Manzura is grateful to the Kiva investors for the support and understanding.

loans.use: to obtain medical treatment

loans.name: Eduardo Atilio

texts.es:
Eduardo es un hombre que tiene una pequeña de 16 años por la que se desvive día a día y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro y parejo para darle lo mejor. Él disfruta mucho pasar tiempo con ella y llevarla a pasear en el auto que posee. Eduardo vive en la ciudad de Ica, actualmente no vive con su hija debido a que es separado, pero está muy contento por poder verla y visitarla el mayor tiempo posible.

Eduardo es un hombre que trabaja diariamente brindando el servicio de transporte público en su propio auto en el cercado de la ciudad de Ica, actualmente labora un promedio de 10 horas diarias y sabe que le está yendo bien porque es una persona responsable y prudente al momento de conducir su automóvil. 

El sabe que su auto ya está un poco viejo y es por eso que desea  realizarle el mantenimiento general y también realizar el cambio de llantas que necesita, con este arreglo podrá realizar su trabajado de manera más segura y así con el tiempo tramitar la compra de un nuevo auto y así su hija podrá convertirse en una gran profesional , su gran sueño.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a man with a 16 year old daughter for whom he works daily and is prepared to work hard to provide the best for her.  He really enjoys spending time with her and taking her for rides in his car.  Eduardo lives in the city of Ica.  He doesn’t live with his daughter because he is separated, but he is very happy to be able to see her and visit her as much as possible.

Eduardo works every day, providing public transportation with his own car around Ica.  He works ten hours a day and knows that things are going well for him because he is a responsible and prudent person when he drives.

He knows that his car is a bit old and so he wants to perform general maintenance and also replace the tires.  These repairs will allow him to work more safely and eventually allow him to buy a new car.  He wants to see his daughter become a professional.  This is his greatest dream.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Orostamo

texts.ru: Оростамо жительница района Хамадони. Она замужем. Ей 41 год. У нее трое детей. Оростамо предоставляет услугу, она портниха. В основном она занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Кредит берет для покупки двух швейных машинок и тканей.
texts.en: Orostamo lives in the Hamadoni region. She is 41 years old, married, and has three children. Orostamo offers seamstress services, sewing mainly traditional dresses. She is taking this loan to buy two sewing machines and fabric.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines and fabric

loans.name: Jonathan Gerardo

texts.es: Jonathan Gerardo, tiene la edad 22 de  años, está soltero y vive con sus padres. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de una vaca de leche para vender la leche y hacer queso también para la venta. El cuenta con dos vacas más en su poder y lo que pretende es fortalecer el proyecto. El quiere producir más leche y queso y un poco de natilla,  para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de sus padres y crecer con el proyecto de vacas de leche. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Jonathan Gerardo is 22; he is single and lives with his parents. With the loan, he is seeking to buy a dairy cow in order to sell milk and make cheese, which he will also sell. He already has two cows, and what he seeks to do is strengthen his project. He wants to produce more milk and cheese, and a little bit of custard, in order to later sell it in the local market or surrounding villages. He wants to generate greater profits for his own wellbeing and that of his parents, and expand the dairy cows project. It is the first loan that he receives from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans with state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia de 52 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa exterior e interior y también tiene un negocio mediante el cual vende al detal dulce de leche o arequipe.  Ella es una mujer  que tiene 6 hijos en las edades de 26 a 31 años y entre ellos hay dos pares de mellos;  todos ellos son su alegría y sueña con que cada día de su vida prosperen paso a paso.  En sus 16 años de experiencia ha trabajado mucho, inicialmente antes de dedicarse a esta actividad comercial,  trabajó empleada en una familia, pero cuando crecieron sus hijos no quisieron que ella continuara en esta actividad; así fue como con el producto de su liquidación, invirtió en prendas que vendió entre sus amigas y con las cuales les fue muy bien y con ellas logró hacer crecer su mercado y logró diversificar su oferta. Sus compras las hace en el centro de la ciudad cuando hay ofertas  importantes, promociones y saldos,  que le salen a un mejor precio. Por eso cuando las vende le gana dinero, sin recargar tanto a sus clientes, que le compran a crédito. En su negocio dos de sus hijos recuperan su cartera, contribuyendo así con el desempeño del negocio. Sonia también tiene otra actividad productiva, pues compra galones de arequipes de 2 a tres veces por semana y los envasa en porciones unitarias en vasos de una onza. Este último negocio ha tenido mucha acogida entre sus clientes, que los compran como golosinas para que sus hijos dispongan de ellas y se deleiten. La familia que Sonia conforma con sus hijos es muy unida, por eso en cada paso que da ella es respaldada; con ellos  comparte gastos y le ayudan en todo. En su venta de arequipe no necesita de activos fijos, pues no maneja inventarios. Como Sonia es una mujer tan cociente de la oportunidad también se dedica a la venta de frituras, que traslada a otro barrio donde tiene un punto de ventas,  atendido por uno de sus hijos y estos son ingresos adicionales que también recibe. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mercancías variadas en promoción. Su credikiva es una inversión exitosa,  porque le permite tener un dinero disponible para responder a pedidos, ya que  los plazos otorgados a sus clientes,  muchas veces no le facilitan el dar una respuesta oportuna a los nuevos compradores a crédito y esto con su credikiva será posible.
texts.en:
Sonia, 52, sells clothes and underwear and also has a business selling “dulce de leche” or “arequipe” [caramel].  She has six children whose ages range between 26 and 31 years; among them is a pair of twins.  All of them are her joy and she dreams that they will make progress step by step every day of their lives.

In her 16 years of experience she has worked very hard.  Initially before going into this commercial activity, she worked as a domestic employee for a family but when her children grew up they didn’t want her to continue with this activity so she used the money she got from her severance pay and bought some articles of clothing that she sold among her friends.  She did very well with them and managed to increase her market and to diversify her offer.

She does her purchases in the center of the city when there are important sales, promotions and close-out sales that mean better prices.  This way when she sells them she earns money without having to charge her customers who buy on credit so much.  Two of her children help out collecting payment thus contributing to the business’ operation.

Sonia has an additional productive activity because she buys gallons of arequipe twice or three times a week that she repackages in single serving containers of one ounce each.  This last business has been very well received by her customers who buy them as treats for their children to enjoy.

The family that Sonia forms with her children is very united which is why every step she takes is supported; she shares expenses with them and they help her out in everything.  Her arequipe sales don’t require fixed assets since she keeps no standing inventory.

Because Sonia is aware of opportunities, she also sells fried fast food that she takes to a different neighborhood where she has a sales point one of her children tends to and this is additional income she also receives.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she will use to buy assorted merchandise that’s on special promotion.  Her Kiva loan is a successful investment because it allows her to have money on hand to respond to orders because the time frame she offers her customers sometimes prevents her from being able to respond in a timely fashion to new credit customers and with the Kiva loan this will be possible.

loans.use: to buy assorted merchandise that's on special promotion.

loans.name: 20 De Julio Group

texts.es:
20 de julio es el grupo formado por 20 mujeres de la ciudad de Asunción, ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que siempre se esfuerzan al máximo para poder ayudar a sus familias y sus hijos. Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya.
Marcela es una de las miembros del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, y nos comenta que siempre tiene muy buena venta, ya que está muy bien abastecida y surtida. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma seguir creciendo como microempresario.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, para mantener surtido su negocio, y de esa forma continuar trabajando y ayudando a su familia. Agradecen todas las miembros por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
“20 de Julio” (July 20) is a group formed by 20 women from the city of Asunción.  They are very hardworking, enterprising people who always strive to the maximum degree to help their families and their children.  The group is currently in the third cycle in Fundación Paraguaya’s Enterprising Women Program.

Marcela is one of the group members.  She sells all sorts of clothes and comments that her sales are very good because she’s well stocked.  Her goal is to be able to continue working and growing as a micro businesswoman.

She requested the loan to buy clothes to keep her business stocked and continue working to help her family.  All the members are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Nubia Esther

texts.es: Nubia compró con su credikiva electrodomésticos menores, que vendió a crédito a sus clientes y aumentó su cartera de cuentas por cobrar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará lavadoras, porque próximamente adicionará a sus ingresos el servicio de lavadoras que ofrecerá especialmente a amas de casa para que puedan descansar un poco de la lavada manual y a pleno sol. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente:  “Mis agradecimientos por confiar en mi negocio . Me fue muy bien durante el crédito. “
texts.en: Nubia used her Kiva loan to buy small appliances that she sold to her customers on credit thus increasing her accounts receivable portfolio.  She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan to buy washing machines because she will soon add washing machine services to her income.  She will offer the service especially to housewives so that they can rest a bit from manual washing under the hot sun.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following:  “Thank you for trusting in my business.  I did very well during the loan.”

loans.use: to buy washing machines.

loans.name: Kuldar

texts.ru:
Кульдар 57 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Кульдар на протяжении 15 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки дойной коровы. Благодаря упорному труду Кульдар в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 6 овец. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кульдар обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец.  Доходы от кредита Кульдар планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en: Kuldar is 57 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has been raising livestock for 15 years, having started her business with a purchase of a dairy cow. Thanks to Kuldar's dedicated work, today her farm has 1 dairy cow, 1 calf, and 6 sheep. In order to continue developing her business, Kuldar has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners  for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy additional sheep. She plans to use her profits from this loan to further increase the size of her herd.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Reina Jenny

texts.es: La Sra. Reina  tiene 20 años y es soltera no tiene hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de calculadoras, ella vende de manera ambulante por las calles de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Reina utilizara este préstamo para la compra de variedad de calculadoras científicas por mayor  para su negocio, Reina   enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay muchas vendedoras con los mismos productos,  utilizara los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida, Reina sueña por su negocio es conseguir un puesto fijo de venta, es una persona joven y emprendedora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad con la que se mantiene.
texts.en: Reina, 20, is single and has no children.  She’s a street vendor selling calculators in the streets of the city of Cochabamba.  This loan is her first sequence within our institution.  Reina will use this loan to buy an assortment of scientific calculators at wholesale for her business.  The challenge Reina faces in her business is competition because there are many sellers of the same products.  She will use profits to improve her quality of life.  Reina's dream for her business is getting a fixed sales point.  She is a young, enterprising person who feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided because this is the only activity she has to support herself.

loans.use: to buy calculators.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: La Sra. Roxana tiene 23 años y es soltera no tiene hijos, ella se dedica al canto tiene una agrupación musical donde amenizan todo acontecimiento social también viajan a realizar presentaciones a las provincias de la ciudad de Cochabamba  La Sra. Roxana es la vocalista del  grupo,  este  préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, Roxana utilizara este préstamo para  la compra de un instrumento musical que es el bajo, la  razón para solicitar este préstamo es requerimiento de un bajo para el grupo, Roxana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varios grupos musicales como el de ella pero se siente feliz ya que siempre tienen contratos, y utilizara los beneficios en la compra de mas instrumentos musicales, Roxana desea que su grupo sea reconocido internacionalmente, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado. En la Foto esta con su agrupación ya que ella nos proporciono la foto,  ella es la persona que se encuentra en el centro de la fotografía.
texts.en:
Roxana, 23, is single and has no children.  She is singer in a music group that entertains at all kinds of social events; they also travel to perform in the city of Cochabamba’s provinces.  Roxana is the group’s vocalist and this loan is her first sequence within the institution.  Roxana will use this loan to buy a musical instrument: a base guitar.  The reason for asking for the loan is that the group needs a base guitar.

The challenge Roxana faces in her business is competition since there are several musical groups like hers but she feels happy because they always have contracts and she will use profits to buy more musical instruments.  Roxana wants her group to be recognized internationally.  

She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.  She appears in the photo with her group since she provided us with the photo.  She’s the person in the center of the photo.

loans.use: to buy a base guitar.

loans.name: Sitam

texts.ru: Ситам проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 69 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена и сын находятся в Российской Федерации на заработках. Сам он занимается животноводством. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Sitam lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 69 years old, married, and has four children. His wife and son are currently working in Russia. Sitam raises livestock and is taking this loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Popo

texts.en:
Popo is married and has two children who attend school. Her husband 'works as a driver. Popo operates a food vending business and sells her goods from home. Her primary customers are neighbors and passersby. 

Popo is requesting a loan for 50,000 KES, which she will use to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil. She describes her greatest business challenge to be competition and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Popo aspires to establish a restaurant business in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to establish another business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Epifamia

texts.es: Epifamia de 58 años vive (suburbio Guayaquil ) ella decidió ponerse un negocio de costura el cua le va bien .aparte se dedica a hacer comidas para fiestas como quinceañeras. Ella trabaja todos los días sola . a  futuro ella desea comprarse un  horno especial  y poner su negocio en otra parte . Con el préstamo comprara ( telas, ropa).
texts.en: Epifamia is 58 and lives in a suburb of Guayaquil. She decided to start a sewing business, which is going well. Aside from that, she earns a living making food for parties, such as for the 15th birthday galas for young girls. She works alone every day. In the future, she wishes to buy herself a special oven and relocate her business. With the loan she will buy fabrics and clothing.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and clothing

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: El Sr. Sergio  tiene 35 años no es casado pero convive con su pareja con la cual tiene 3 hijos que son  de las edades de 6, 4 y 1 años, se dedica a la  agricultura su parcela se encuentran ubicada en la localidad de Sombrerito, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, Sergio utilizara  este préstamo  para la compra de semillas para la siembra de papa y cosecha de arroz la razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumento de capital, el Sr. Sergio enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y utilizara los beneficios par mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia, El Sr. Sergio es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sergio, 35, isn’t married but lives with his spouse with whom he has three children who are 6, 4 and 1 years old.  He’s a farmer and his parcel is located in Sombrerito.  This loan is his first sequence within the institution.  He will use it to buy seeds for the potato crop and rice harvest.  The reason for requesting the loan is to increase working capital.

The challenge Sergio faces in his business is to rise out of poverty.  He will use profits to improve his and his family’s quality of life.  Sergio is a very hardworking person who feels happy and grateful for the support provided by the institution.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Jose Livardo

texts.es: Jose de 54 años vive ( suburbio Guayaquil ) . jose hace 12 años perdio su empleo por motivo de esto el convenció a su esposa para poner un retaurante que hasta ahora le ha ido bien. El trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación con su esposa . a futuro el desea que su negocio se mantenga bien como ahora. Con el préstamo comprara ( sillas mesas etc) .
texts.en: Jose, 54, lives in El Suburbio, Guayaquil. Jose lost his job 12 years ago, so he convinced his wife to start a restaurant. So far, it has gone well for him. He works very hard and with dedication along with his wife. In the future, he hopes his business remains good like it is now. With the loan, he will buy chairs, tables, etc.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables

loans.name: Jose Gerardo

texts.es: José Gerardo, tiene la edad  de 53 años de edad, está casado y vive con sus dos hijos y la esposa .El pretende con el crédito asistir el café. El  pretende invertir en insumos como, abonos, herbicidas, fumigaciones y mano de obra para octener el máximo de ganancias y rendimiento. El quiere obtener un café en perfectas condiciones  y una exelente produccion y asi obtener la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y el de su familia y así tener una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José Gerardo, 53, is married living with his two children and his wife.  He intends to use the loan for his coffee crops.  He intends to invest the loan in supplies like manure, herbicide, fumigation and labor costs to obtain the maximum possible profit and yield.  He wants to obtain coffee that’s in perfect conditions as well as an excellent production to thus obtain the greatest possible amount of profits for his and his family’s wellbeing and thus attain better economic stability.

This is his first loan from Fudecosur.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks but Fudecosur offered the best loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Domingo Jose

texts.es: Domingo de  31 años, casado, comerciante y técnico medio en administración, originario de Chinandega, su negocio es una pulpería con dos años de experiencia, lo puso con capital propio y apoyo de su esposa, antes trabajo por más de tres años  en una empresa privada la cual cerro. En vez de seguir buscando empleo en empresas privadas decidió poner su propio negocio con la liquidación que le dieron y fue de esta manera que junto con su esposa trabajan por sacar adelante su pulpería.; solicito el crédito para comprar granos básicos, pollo, carnes, jugos , gaseosas, enlatados, productos de limpieza etc. Su meta principal es terminar su carrera universitaria de contabilidad financiera y mejorar su pulpería.
texts.en: Domingo, 31, is married; he’s a merchant and a mid-level management technician from Chinandega.  His business is a grocery store that he’s had for two years.  He set it up with his own capital and help from his wife.  Prior to that he worked for two years for a private firm that went out of business.  Instead of continuing to look for work in private firms he decided to use the liquidation he was given to open his own business and this is how together with his wife they work to succeed with their grocery store.  The loan he requested is to buy basic grains, chicken, meats, juices, soft-drinks, canned goods, cleaning supplies, etc.  His goal is to complete his university career in financial accounting and to improve his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, chicken, meat, juice, soft-drinks, canned goods, cleaning supplies, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Exitosas Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Mujeres Exitosas” es un grupo que está conformado por 09 socios comprometidos, la cual llevan 04 meses trabajando con el Programa- Prosperidad. Siendo Yolanda la secretaria del grupo. Yolanda de 55 años de edad es separada con 05 hijos, 01 de ellos aún dependiente. Hace más de 05 años que Yolanda se dedica a la venta de ropa la cual trabaja sobre pedidos ya que por el momento no cuenta con un local propio. Aparte realiza trabajos manuales de donde obtiene un ingreso mas para su hogar. Con su trabajo y dedicación a podido apoyar a sus hijos en su educación y aumentar su capital de trabajo. Con el fin de seguir creciendo en su negocio solicito el crédito para comprar prendas como polos, casacas, chores, etc. y de esta manera tener que ofrecer a sus clientes. Yolanda tiene como objetivo poner una boutique donde pueda ofrecer sus prendas. La Alcancía Comunal “Mujeres Exitosas” agradecen el crédito brindado ya que hacen posible su progreso.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Exitosas” (Successful Women) communal bank is composed of nine committed members who have been working for four months in Programa-Prosperidad.  Yolanda is group secretary.  She is 55 years old, separated and has five children one of which is still dependent.

Yolanda has been working selling clothes for over five years.  She works based on prior orders and does not have a locale of her own at present.  She also does crafts work to earn extra income for her home.  With her work and dedication she’s been able to support her children’s education and increase working capital.

Aiming to continue growing in her business she’s asked for a loan to buy clothes like polo shirts, jackets, shorts, etc. in order to offer her customers.  

The “Mujeres Exitosas” communal bank are grateful for the loan granted since it makes their progress possible.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Ann has a shop that sells variety of fish; her husband is a fisherman. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy fish to sell. 

Ann has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Ann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. 

Florencio has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to resell. 

Florencio has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Florencio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for resale

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Liezel provides multipurpose cab services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the multipurpose cab. 

Liezel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Liezel hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the multipurpose cab

loans.name: Jetypeka Group

texts.es:
El comité “Jetypeka” tiene más de 1 año de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya, la mayoría de sus integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas. Ellas anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación.
Celsa es una de las miembros del grupo, y ella se dedica a la venta de variadas clases de prendas, lo cual la ha ayudado a poder mantener a su familia y darles todo lo que necesitan para una mejor vida. Su sueño es poder tener un local grande donde pueda ofrecer más variedades de prendas a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para abastecerse con más variedad de prendas, ya que se acerca la temporada de frio y quiere poder surtirse bien. Agradece por el apoyo que recibe de la fundación y de Kiva.
texts.en:
The “Jetypeka” committee has been in existence and working with Fundación Paraguaya for over a year.  Most of its members are already carrying out productive activities.  They hope for a better future for their children and this is why they strive doubly hard to provide materials for their growth and development.

Celsa is one of the group members.  She sells assorted articles of clothing which has helped her support her family and give them all they need for a better life.  Her dream is to be able to have a large locale where she can sell a still larger variety of articles of clothing to her customers.

She is asking for the loan to stock up on more clothes since the cold season is approaching and she wants to be well stocked.  She is grateful for the support she gets from the Fundación and from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
Expedita is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Expedita provides motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

Expedita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Expedita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy tools and gasoline

loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en:
Rodulfo is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 1 child. 

Rodulfo provides motorela or motorcycle with sidecar services. He has had this business for 6 years. He requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Rodulfo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Rodulfo hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: buy tools and gasoline

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated from her spouse and has 2 children. 

Aida has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store) that buys & sells canned goods, snacks like rice cakes & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy snacks, beverages & raw ingredients needed for making rice cakes.

Aida has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Milicent

texts.en:
Milicent is a 37-year-old married woman. She has 3 children between the ages of 1 and 21 and 1 is enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Geoffrey and he works as a driver. 

Milicent operates a clothes selling business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. Milicent's other source of income includes selling tea leaves. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is school fees. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Milicent will use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. Milicent aspires to expand her chicken house in the future. She joined Yehu because of its affordable interest rates.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Myrna has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She is also selling rice per kilogram. She has had this business for 5 years. 

Myrna requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy snacks, beverages & sacks of  rice to sell.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy snacks, beverages & rice

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has 5 children. 

Edna has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store) that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Edna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Edna hopes to improve her business.

Carlos is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 4 children.

Carlos has been a member of HSPFI for since 2010.  In the future, Carlos hopes to improve his business.

Necilyn requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages to resell.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Necilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.name: Vencent

Vencent provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 3 years. He requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Vencent has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Vencent hopes to improve his services.
